Configurations API

Configurations API

GeoIQ servers have full customization and configuration of settings such as if logged in users are required, streaming is enabled, SSL, and more. This information can be obtained by requesting from the configurations API.

Endpoint: http://geocommons.com/configurations.:format

Description: GeoIQ Configuration

HTTP Methods Available: GET

URL Summary:

Task URL Formats HTTP METHOD
Analyze http://geocommons.com/configurations.:format json POST

Response

A public user will receive a limited information:

{ “platform”: “cloud”, “use_client_certificates”: "", “instance_id”: “customer.geoiq.com”, “revision”: “ab1ce050b52313d70ba082d07e2c8570f83f116b\n”, “version”: “ab1ce050b52313d70ba082d07e2c8570f83f116b\n”, “basemap_list”: "", “socket_server”: null, “enable_sockets”: null, “feature_render_limit”: “25000”, “enable_streaming”: null, “streaming_data_store_id”: null, “require_ssl_for_login”: "" }

An admin user will receive the entire configuration:

{ “dynamic_geometry_limit”: “10000”, “enable_streaming”: null, “default_file_size_limit”: “104857600”, “climgen_enabled”: “false”, “geocoder_enabled”: “true”, “async_geolocate_gecode_limit”: “100”, “kml_file_size_limit_description”: “Twenty (20) megabytes”, “preview_images_enabled”: "", “basemap_list”: "", “addthis_profile_id”: null, “kml_file_size_limit”: “20485760”, “classifications”: "", “licenses”: “12”, “user_limit”: "", “addthis_twitter_user”: null, “private_data_licensed”: “true”, “periodically_compute_dynamic_statistics”: “f”, “user_defined_groups_enabled”: “false”, “streaming_data_store_id”: null, “password_expiration”: “90”, “async_file_processing”: "", “upsell_whitelist”: "", “georss_file_size_limit_description”: “Five (5) Megabytes”, “concurrent_analysis_limit”: “2”, “revision”: “ab1ce050b52313d70ba082d07e2c8570f83f116b\n”, “updated_at”: “Wed Sep 29 18:25:47 UTC 2010”, “allow_signup”: “true”, “async_licensed”: “false”, “async_geolocate_gejoin_limit”: “10”, “async_analysis_enabled”: "", “identity”: “Customer name”, “private_data_limiting_enabled”: “false”, “enable_data_classification”: "", “user_defined_group_limiting_enabled”: “false”, “geocoder_row_limit_description”: "5, 000 Rows", “enable_sockets”: null, “require_login”: "", “enable_classification_notice”: "", “periodic_analysis_limit”: “10”, “paranoid_deletion_enabled”: “false”, “analysis_enabled”: “true”, “upsell_enabled”: “f”, “feature_limit”: “10000”, “socket_server”: null, “require_ssl_for_login”: "", Example

Configurations API

GeoIQ servers have full customization and configuration of settings such as if logged in users are required, streaming is enabled, SSL, and more. This information can be obtained by requesting from the configurations API.

Endpoint: http://geocommons.com/configurations.:format

Description: GeoIQ Configuration

HTTP Methods Available: GET

URL Summary:

Task URL Formats HTTP METHOD
Analyze http://geocommons.com/configurations.:format json POST

Response

A public user will receive a limited information:

{ “platform”: “cloud”, “use_client_certificates”: "", “instance_id”: “customer.geoiq.com”, “revision”: “ab1ce050b52313d70ba082d07e2c8570f83f116b\n”, “version”: “ab1ce050b52313d70ba082d07e2c8570f83f116b\n”, “basemap_list”: "", “socket_server”: null, “enable_sockets”: null, “feature_render_limit”: “25000”, “enable_streaming”: null, “streaming_data_store_id”: null, “require_ssl_for_login”: "" }

An admin user will receive the entire configuration:
